This expertise has been developed over twenty years spent building successful digital businesses and products - across the world.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Analyst - Import/Export

Location: Chandler, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Are you looking for a unique opportunity to be a part of something great? Want to join a 20,000-member team that works on the technology that powers the world around us? Looking for an atmosphere of trust, empowerment, respect, diversity, and communication? How about an opportunity to own a piece of a multi-billion dollar (with a B!) global organization? We offer all that and more at Microchip Technology, Inc.

People come to work at Microchip because we help design the technology that runs the world. They stay because our culture supports their growth and stability. They are challenged and driven by an incredible array of products and solutions with unlimited career potential. Microchip’s nationally-recognized Leadership Passage Programs support career growth where we proudly enroll over a thousand people annually. We take pride in our commitment to employee development, values-based decision making, and strong sense of community, driven by our Vision, Mission, and 11 Guiding Values; we affectionately refer to it as the Aggregate System and it’s won us countless awards for diversity and workplace excellence.

Our company is built by dedicated team players who love to challenge the status quo; we did not achieve record revenue and over 30 years of quarterly profitability without a great team dedicated to empowering innovation. People like you.

Visit our careers page to see what exciting opportunities and company perks await!

Job Description

The Trade Compliance Analyst position will be responsible for supporting Microchip’s Global Trade Compliance (GTC) group and the Licensing Team in particular, and will be a key member of the GTC Licensing Team. The Licensing Team has responsibility for determining if a license is needed for a transaction, and then creating and submitting an appropriate application. In addition, the team is responsible for the timely review of customer due diligence information, including support of our Field Sales and Sales Support teams. The team is also responsible for timely management of the reviews of sales orders that may be subject to export controls, supporting other departments like HR, Business Units, Operations and Logistics, etc. The Licensing Team reviews all End User documentation from Customers, Suppliers, and other partners and enters relevant data into the Corporate ERP system.

This position will also be an active participant in the team, supporting Microchip daily reports, timely application and release of export holds, and be a contributing member of an international team.

Key Responsibilities

Support the analysis of sales orders to determine if a license is needed on a timely basis.Provide support to other Trade Compliance locations worldwide in matters of Licensing, Due Diligence, and Order Review.Follow procedures for reviewing customer due diligence information to quickly identify and act on red flags and otherwise clear orders for shipment.Follow procedures for automated sales order reviews or exceptions to quickly clear low risk orders for shipment.Maintain licensing and due diligence records in accordance with US Government Agencies and company requirements.Support and collaborate with internal business partners to ensure best in class practices are embedded into business functions.Be a key contributor to the Global Trade Compliance team, including developing a close working relationship with other team members.

Requirements/Qualifications

5+ years of experience in a Trade Compliance roleWorking knowledge of U.S. Customs regulations and/or Export Administration RegulationsKnowledge of export controls applications such as Visual Compliance, Integration Point, Trade Automation, etc.Proficient with enterprise resource planning (ERP) software such as BAAN, Oracle, AX, etc.Familiarity with some other aspects of Trade Compliance such as the CCL (particularly regarding Electronics and Encryption categories), Import regulations, export filing requirements, general procedures for international shipments, etc.Ability to multitaskComfortable with changing priorities and a fast-paced environmentStrong ability to work within a distributed teamSignificant attention to detail.Proficient in Outlook, Word, Excel, and Teams.Ability to work independently and manage deadlines.Overall enthusiasm for departmental success.Exceptional analytical, written, & verbal communication skills.Strong interpersonal skills and people orientated approach.Experience in a Semiconductor Manufacturing company is highly desirable

This position is not eligible for Microchip immigration sponsorship.

Travel Time

0% - 25%

Physical Attributes

Seeing, Talking, Works Alone, Works Around Others

Physical Requirements

seeing, talking, hearing

Microchip Technology Inc is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, please refer to the EEO is the Law Poster and the EEO is the Law Poster Supplement. Please also refer to the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
